refnamediv.refpurpose: Variable database representation of ring buffers.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This page describes how the variable database is used to represent ring buffers. A ringbuffer is a one to many data distribution scheme. Remote processes can gain access to data via a proxy ringbuffer whose feeder mechanism also provides traffic concentration.

The variable database uses the directory /RingBuffers to hold all information about the ring buffers it uses. The information for each ring buffer is held in a directory below /RingBuffers. The name of the directory is of the form ringname@host where ringname is the raw name of the ringbuffer and host is the name of the host in which the ring buffer is created.
The following variables are then defined within each ring buffer directory:

seglistitem.seg: The number of bytes of data buffer in the ring buffer. This value defines the largest item that can be put in the ringbuffer. The size does not include the amount of storage required for headers etc.
The maximum number of consumers that can simultaneously acquire data from the ringbuffer.
